title: I have $13,000 and I want to invest in Bitcoin. Where do I put my money? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anywhere other than BitCoin. BitCoin has no intrinsic value. You’d be buying it on the “Greater fool” theory, which assumes that you’ll find someone dumber than you who will pay more for it. Buy ETFs that cover Bank and Utility stocks. It’s a safe investment that will yield 5% a year, and have good capital growth. Every 7 years you should reasonably expect the investment to double and you won’t lie awake wondering if you’ve lost your money. Investing in Bitcoin is a gamble, not an investment. You might be lucky and double your money in a year, or you might lose it all. At least in a casino you get free drinks while you lose money.

13000 USD is not enough to set up a crypto farm, and if you don't have trading background, you may lose a lot of money.Cloud mining is ideal, you should pick the right contract to invest in.I always consider RRMine's products as investment, not mining products.
